Logistics Overview: Logistics Fundamentals
   
  Logistics Doctrine: What is Doctrine?  
         
 

Fundamentals of Logistics is a doctrine-based course. In this course, we will address organizational and operational issues presented in our service and joint logistics doctrines. But, what is doctrine?

The DoD Dictionary defines doctrine as:

Fundamental principles by which the military forces or elements thereof guide their actions in support of national objectives. It is authoritative but requires judgment in application.

  
   
 

Since we will be using the Air Force logistics structure as the basis for discussion, Air Force Doctrine Document 4-0: Combat Support will serve as the outline for this text as well as much of the course.

Joint Pub 4-0, Doctrine for Logistics Support of Joint Operations, relates logistics to combat operations and warfighting capabilities in a variety of ways.
